hintsUsed.content: She is quite intelligent and a very quick learner.
I'm quite tired after the long walk.
The movie was quite good, I enjoyed it.

She is quite intelligent and a very quick learner.

words.notes: Può riferirsi alla temperatura o a una malattia.
sentences: It's cold outside, you should wear a coat.
I have a cold and a sore throat.
The water was too cold for swimming.

words.notes: Avverbio con diverse sfumature di significato, spesso usato per esprimere preferenze o per attenuare un'affermazione.
sentences: I would rather stay home tonight.
She was rather upset by the news.
He's rather good at playing the piano.

words.notes: Usato per indicare un grado di qualcosa, a volte con un significato di 'abbastanza' o 'piuttosto' e a volte con un significato di 'completamente'.
sentences: I'm quite tired after the long walk.
The movie was quite good, I enjoyed it.
She is quite intelligent and a very quick learner.
I am still waiting for my package to arrive.
Even still, I think we should try again.
The water was so still that it reflected the trees perfectly.
words.notes: La parola 'still' ha diversi significati a seconda del contesto: avverbio di tempo, congiunzione, aggettivo.

sentences: He suddenly remembered he had a meeting.
words.notes: Avverbio di tempo che indica un'azione che accade inaspettatamente.
Jerked = forma passata. Critica consolidamento >2 settimane
sentences: The car jerked to a stop

words.notes: Può riferirsi sia a oggetti fisici che a qualità intellettuali.
sentences: Be careful, that edge is sharp.

words.notes: Threw = forma passata. Critica consolidamento >2 settimane

sentences: The shop is located on the corner of Main Street.
He was standing in the corner of the room.
I turned the corner and saw the park.
words.notes: Può riferirsi a un angolo di una stanza o di una strada.
Fear can be both a noun and a verb.
sentences: I have a great fear of heights.
She overcame her fear of public speaking.
There is no need to fear the unknown.

words.notes: Tuck in = rimboccare, tuck away = nascondere. Alta priorità
Worth it = ne vale la pena. Media priorità
Throw a tantrum = fare i capricci
